Description: Upper section of a glazed steatite shabti of Pediamenope with a lappet-wig, a carved face, crossed hands in low relief holding the hoes, the waist bears a remnant of an inscription consisting of the name of Amun, the back is decorated with an incised representation of a seed-basket, the legs are missing.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
